newsitem.title: USA: No damaging cold expected for Brazil coffee - WSC.
newsitem.headline: No damaging cold expected for Brazil coffee - WSC.

text.p: A storm system is expected to form off the south coast of Brazil bringing colder air into the coffee belt on Sunday, however the airmass should not be cold enough to cause crop damage, Weather Services Corp said in an update on Thursday.
"The airmass is not expected to be cold enough to produce damaging cold in the coffee belt," WSC said. However, "this situation bears close watching."
According to WSC, temperatures could cool to below normal levels. Lows will range from 37-45 F (3-7 C).
Heavy rains were reported throughout the coffee belt this morning. Temperatures were near normal ranging from 54-63 F (12-17 C).

For the next 48 hours, partly to mostly cloudy skies are predicted with episodes of scattered showers and thunderstorms. Partial clearing is expected on Saturday. Temperatures should remain near to below normal with lows in the 50's to 60's F (low to middle teens C).
